page.title: 11A LITTLEPORT ANTIQUE SHOP
page.content:
The shop in{Main Street}was built on one floor in about 1650 and a second floor, ladder and thatched roof on pitch pine beams (a local wood) was added in the next century. A river runs underground below the front of the shop. One family owned the house from 1864 to 1978. There are two empty cottages in the garden (rental 2 shillings) with thatched roofs under corrugated iron.
The present owner has many{artefacts of the local area, including a Roman coin found in Camel Road, Delft plates and a postcard of the 1912 fire engine.
The{ghost}of a lady in a long dress was seen standing behind the shop recently.
